com.engiweb.profilemanager.common.ruleengine.action.reorganize.accesscertifier

Class OrgUnitReviewAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engiweb.profilemanager.common.ruleengine.action.reorganize.accesscertifier.OrgUnitReviewAction

  • public final class OrgUnitReviewAction
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to manage 'OrgUnitReviewAction' entities through Drools rules engine

    • Method Detail

      • findOrganizationalUnit

        public static <any> findOrganizationalUnit(DAO sql,
                                           OrgUnitReviewBean orgUnitReviewBean,
                                           boolean hierarchy,
                                           JobUnitReviewOption jobUnitReviewOption,
                                           UserBean reviewerUser,
                                           AttestationBean attestationBean,
                                           Paging paging)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method returns a Beanlist containing the organization unit to review of the attestation given, assigned to the reviewer provided and according to the filters given. The reviewStatus filter is an integer parameter used to specify if the search must include the jobunits previously reviewed or not. The allowed values for this filter are: NULL-no filtering,0-PENDING, 1-APPROVED,2-REVOKED,3-REVOKING, 20-COMPLETE. The ownerStatus filter is an integer parameter used to specify how the reviewer is involved in the search. The allowed values for this filter are: 10-only the jobUnit reviews redirected to the reviewer, 20-only the jobUnit reviews redirected by the reviewer, 30-only the jobUnit reviews returned by the reviewer, other values- only the jobUnit reviews assigned to the reviewer. The visibilityViolation Boolean parameter is used to specify if the search must be limited to the jobUnit reviews with entitlement in visibility violation or not. The allowed values for this filter are: NULL-no filtering, 0-no filtering, 1-only jobUnit reviews with entitlement in visibility violation The hierarchy boolean flag is used to specify if the organization unit filter must be used in a punctual or in a hierarchical way.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        orgUnitReviewBean - organization unit filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        hierarchy - boolean flag used to specify if the organization unit filter must be used in a punctual or in a hierarchical way
        jobUnitReviewOption - in this argument can be set: 1.reviewStatus integer parameter used to specify the status of the organization unit review to search Allowed values: NULL-no filtering, 0-PENDING, 1-APPROVED, 2-REVOKED, 3-REVOKING, 20-COMPLETE, 2.ownerStatus integer parameter used to specify how the reviewer is involved in the search. Allowed values: 10-only the jobUnit reviews redirected to the reviewer 20-only the jobUnit reviews redirected by the reviewer 30-only the jobUnit reviews returned by the reviewer other values-only the jobUnit reviews assigned to the reviewer 3.visibilityViolation Boolean parameter used to specify if the the search must be limited to the jobUnit reviews with entitlement in visibility violation or not Allowed values: NULL-no filtering, 0-no filtering, 1-only jobUnit reviews with entitlement in visibility violation
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        Returns:
        list of organization unit reviews for the given reviewer attestation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • findReview

        public static <any> findReview(DAO sql,
                               JobUnitReviewBean jobUnitReviewBean,
                               java.lang.Boolean incomp,
                               JobUnitReviewOption jobUnitReviewOption,
                               AttestationBean attestationBean,
                               UserBean reviewerUser,
                               Paging paging)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        The method returns a Beanlist containing the job units to review assigned to the reviewer provided and according to the filters given. It is possible to filter by application and job unit. The reviewOption filter is an object parameter used to specify search criteria to apply. It must contains attestation value at least. The incomp Boolean parameter is used to specify if the search must be limited to the jobUnit reviews with entitlement with violations or not. The allowed values for this filter are: NULL-no filtering, 0-no filtering, 1-only jobUnit reviews with entitlement with violation.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        incomp - Boolean parameter used to specify if the the search must be limited to the jobUnit reviews with entitlement with violation or not Allowed values: NULL-no filtering, 0-no filtering, 1-only jobUnit reviews with entitlement with violation
        jobUnitReviewOption - object used to specify review criteria to use in the search
        attestationBean -
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and uniquely defined.
        paging - used to page the search
        Returns:
        list of job unit to review found
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • approve

        public static void approve(DAO sql,
                           java.lang.String note,
                           UserBean reviewerUser,
                           AttestationBean attestationBean,
                           <any> orgUnitReviewBeans)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method approves the review of the given list of organization unit reviews assigned to the reviewer given of the attestation provided. It is possible to add a note to the approved organization units.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        note - note of the approval
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        orgUnitReviewBeans - list of organization unit reviews to approve, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • approve

                           java.lang.String note,
                           UserBean reviewerUser,
                           <any> blJobUnitReviewBean)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method approves the review of the given list of job unit reviews assigned to the reviewer given. It is possible to add a note to the approved job units.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter

        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely

        java.lang.Exception

      • revoke

        public static void revoke(DAO sql,
                          java.lang.String note,
                          UserBean reviewerUser,
                          AttestationBean attestationBean,
                          <any> orgUnitReviewBeans)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The method rejects the review of the list of organization unit assigned to the reviewer given. It is possible to add a note to the revoked organization units. Depending by the configuration of the attestation, the presence of the note could be mandatory or not. The effectiveness of the revocation depends by the configuration of the attestation and is, in any case, subsequent to the sign off operation.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        note - note of revoke, depending by the configuration of the attestation, it could be mandatory or not
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        orgUnitReviewBeans - list of organization unit reviews to revoke, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • revoke

        public static void revoke(DAO sql,
                          java.lang.String note,
                          UserBean reviewerUser,
                          <any> blJobUnitReviewBean)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The method rejects the review of the list of job unit assigned to the reviewer given. It is possible to add a note to the revoked job units. Depending by the configuration of the attestation, the presence of the note could be mandatory or not. The effectiveness of the revocation depends by the configuration of the attestation and is, in any case, subsequent to the sign off operation.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        note - note of revoke, depending by the configuration of the attestation, it could be mandatory or not
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        blJobUnitReviewBean - list of job unit reviews to revoke, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • redirect

        public static void redirect(DAO sql,
                            ReviewNoteBean noteBean,
                            AttestationBean attestationBean,
                            <any> jobUnitReviewBeans)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method redirects the review of the list of job units assigned, to the reviewer given, to the new reviewer specified. The original reviewer becomes secondary and is enabled to get the attestation back after if the new reviewer decides to return the review. It is possible to add a note to the redirection.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        noteBean - note of redirect
        attestationBean - attestationBean, mandatory and defined uniquely
        jobUnitReviewBeans - list of job unit reviews to redirect, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • redirect

        public static void redirect(DAO sql,
                            ReviewNoteBean noteBean,
                            UserBean reviewerUser,
                            UserBean newReviewerUser,
                            AttestationBean attestationBean,
                            <any> orgUnitReviewBeans)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method redirects the review of the list of organization units assigned, to the reviewer given, to the new reviewer specified of the attestation provided. The original reviewer becomes secondary and is enabled to get the attestation back after if the new reviewer decides to return the review. It is possible to add a note to the redirection.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        noteBean - note of redirect
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        newReviewerUser - new user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        orgUnitReviewBeans - list of organization unit reviews to redirect, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • escalate

        public static void escalate(DAO sql,
                            ReviewNoteBean noteBean,
                            UserBean toSupervisor,
                            UserBean reviewerUser,
                            AttestationBean attestationBean,
                            <any> orgUnitReviewBeans)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method escalates the list of organization unit reviews associated to the reviewer given of the attestation provided to its supervisor. It is possible to add a note to the escalation.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        noteBean - note of escalation
        toSupervisor - supervisor to which escalate the review
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        orgUnitReviewBeans - list of organization unit reviews to escalate, mandatory and each defined uniquely
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • signOff

        public static void signOff(DAO sql,
                           ReviewNoteBean noteBean,
                           UserBean reviewerUser,
                           AttestationBean attestationBean,
                           GroupBean ouBeanToSignOff)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method provides the signoff of the organization unit reviews associated to the reviewer given of the attestation provided. The signoff operation put an end to the reviewing work on the organization unit. It is possible to add a note to the organization unit review signed off.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        noteBean - note of escalation
        reviewerUser - user reviewer, mandatory and defined uniquely
        ouBeanToSignOff - organization unit review to sign off
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • findReviewer

        public static <any> findReviewer(DAO sql,
                                 boolean hierarchy,
                                 OrgUnitBean ouBean,
                                 UserBean userBean,
                                 AttestationBean attestationBean,
                                 Paging paging)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method returns a Beanlist containing the users which are the reviewers of the attestation given. It is possible to filter by user and organization unit. The hierarchy boolean flag is used with the organization unit filter and specify if the it must be used for a punctual or hierarchical search.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        hierarchy - boolean flag used to specify if the organization unit filter must be used for a punctual or hierarchical search
        ouBean - organization unit filter
        userBean - user filter
        attestationBean - attestation filter, mandatory and defined uniquely
        paging -
        Returns:
        list of reviewers of the given attestation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
